gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/207)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ قَالَ

text: اشْتَكَى غُلَامٌ لِأَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فَسَأَلَ عَنْهُ فَقِيلَ بِهِ طُحَالٌ فَقَالَ أَطْعِمُوهُ الْكُرَّاثَ ثَلَاثَةَ أَيَّامٍ فَأَطْعَمْنَاهُ فَقَعَدَ الدَّمُ ثُمَّ بَرَأَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ali Bin Hassan, from Musa Bin Bakr who said,

‘A slave of Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> complained, so he<sup>asws</sup> asked about him, and it was said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘He is with spleen illness’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Feed him the leek for three days’. So we fed it to him, so the blood settled, then he was cured’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ali ibn Hassan from Musa ibn Bakr who has said the following: “Once, a slave of abu al-Hassan complained of illness. He (the Imam) asked about him and it was said that he has spleen trouble. He (the Imam) said, Teed him leeks for three days.’ We fed him, blood formed and he became well.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/208)
text: حَدَّثَنِي مَنْ رَأَى أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَأْكُلُ الْكُرَّاثَ فِي الْمَشَارَةِ وَ يَغْسِلُهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَ يَأْكُلُهُ .

en.hubeali: ‘It was narrated to me by the one who saw Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> eating the leek in the farm, and he<sup>asws</sup> washed it with the water, and he<sup>asws</sup> ate it’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith has said the following: “One who had seen abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, narrated to me that abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al- Salam, ate leeks from the carriage from the farm and washed it with water.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/208)

narrator_chain.text: سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ

text: رَأَيْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقْطَعُ الْكُرَّاثَ بِأُصُولِهِ فَيَغْسِلُهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَ يَأْكُلُهُ .

en.hubeali: Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Al Waleed, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub who said,
‘I saw Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> cutting the leek by its roots, so he<sup>asws</sup> washed it with the water and he<sup>asws</sup> ate it’.
en.sarwar: 3. Sahl ibn Ziyad has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Walid from Yunus ibn Ya’qub who has said the following: “I saw abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, cut leeks from their roots, wash with water and eat.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/208)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ بُنْدَارَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْهَمَذَانِيِّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ فُرَاتِ بْنِ أَحْنَفَ قَالَ

text: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْكُرَّاثِ فَقَالَ كُلْهُ فَإِنَّ فِيهِ أَرْبَعَ خِصَالٍ يُطَيِّبُ النَّكْهَةَ وَ يَطْرُدُ الرِّيَاحَ وَ يَقْطَعُ الْبَوَاسِيرَ وَ هُوَ أَمَانٌ مِنَ الْجُذَامِ لِمَنْ أَدْمَنَ عَلَيْهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Bundar, from his father, from Muhammad Bin Ali Al Hamdany, from Amro Bin Isa, from Furaat Bin Ahnaf who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> was asked about the leek, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Eat it, for therein are four qualities – It aromatises the breath, and it dispels the wind, and it cuts off the hemorrhoids, and it is a safety from the leprosy for the one who is habitual over it’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Bandar has narrated from his father from Muhammad ibn Ali al-Hamadaniy from ‘Amr ibn ‘Isa from Furat ibn Ahnaf who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was asked about leeks and he (the Imam) said, Tat it because it has four qualities. It refreshes one’s breath, dispels gases, cuts down hemorrhoids and it is protection against leprosy for one who eats it very often.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/208)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى أَوْ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ زَكَرِيَّا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: ذُكِرَتِ الْبُقُولُ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) فَقَالَ كُلُوا الْكُرَّاثَ فَإِنَّ مَثَلَهُ فِي الْبُقُولِ كَمَثَلِ الْخُبْزِ فِي سَائِرِ الطَّعَامِ أَوْ قَالَ الْإِدَامِ.

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abdullah, from Muhammad Bin Isa, or someone else, from Abdul Rahman, from Hammad Bin Zakariyya,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The vegetables were mentioned in the presence of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, so he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Eat the leek, for its example among the vegetables is like the example of the bread in the rest of the foods’, or said, ‘Sauces’.
en.sarwar: 5. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa or others from ‘Abd al-Rahman from Hammad ibn Zakariya who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that herbs were mentioned before the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, he (the Messenger of Allah) said, Tat leeks because its likeness in herbs is like bread in other foods’ or he said ‘sauce.’” Uncertainty is from Muhammad ibn Ya‘qub.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/208)
text: عَنْهُ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ أَبِي دَاوُدَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ رَأَى أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) بِخُرَاسَانَ يَأْكُلُ الْكُرَّاثَ مِنَ الْبُسْتَانِ كَمَا هُوَ فَقِيلَ لَهُ إِنَّ فِيهِ السَّمَادَ فَقَالَ ( عليه السلام ) لَا تَعَلَّقُ بِهِ مِنْهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ هُوَ جَيِّدٌ لِلْبَوَاسِيرِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Dawood Bin Abu Dawood,

(It has been narrated) from a man who saw Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> at Khurasan eating the leek from the orchards just as it was. So it was said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘There is compost in it’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Nothing from it attaches to it, and it is good for the hemorrhoids’.
en.sarwar: 6. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from Dawud ibn abu Dawud who has said the following: “A man had seen abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, in Khurasan eating leeks from the garden as it was and it was said to him (the Imam), ‘There is fertilizer with it.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It does not stick to it and it is very good for hemorrhoids.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/208)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ مَعَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَلَى الْمَائِدَةِ فَمِلْتُ عَلَى الْهِنْدَبَاءِ فَقَالَ لِي يَا حَنَانُ لِمَ لَا تَأْكُلُ الْكُرَّاثَ قُلْتُ لِمَا جَاءَ عَنْكُمْ مِنَ الرِّوَايَةِ فِي الْهِنْدَبَاءِ فَقَالَ وَ مَا الَّذِي جَاءَ عَنَّا قُلْتُ إِنَّهُ قِيلَ عَنْكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ قُلْتُمْ إِنَّهُ يُقَطَّرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ قَطْرَةٌ قَالَ فَقَالَ ( عليه السلام ) فَعَلَى الْكُرَّاثِ إِذَنْ سَبْعُ قَطَرَاتٍ قُلْتُ فَكَيْفَ آكُلُهُ قَالَ اقْطَعْ أُصُولَهُ وَ اقْذِفْ بِرُءُوسِهِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from one of his companions, from Hanaan Bin Sudeyr who said,

‘I was with Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> upon the food-spread, so I inclined towards the endive, so he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘O Hanaan! Why are you not eating the leek?’ I said, ‘Due to what has come from you<sup>asws</sup> from the reports regarding the endive’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘And what is that which has come from us<sup>asws</sup>?’ I said, ‘It is said from you<sup>asws</sup> that you<sup>asws</sup> said that a drop from the Paradise falls upon it, every day one drop’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So upon the leek then, seven drops’. I said, ‘So how should I eat it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Cut off its root and throw away its head’.
en.sarwar: 7. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from certain persons of his people from Hanan ibn Sadir who has said the following: “I once was with abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, around the table-spread of food. I reached for the endives and he (the Imam) said to me, ‘O Hanan, why do you not eat leeks?’ I replied, ‘It is because of what is narrated from you in the Hadith about endives.’ He (the Imam) then asked, ‘What is narrated about it from us?’ I replied, ‘It is narrated from you as having said, “Every day one drop falls on it.’” He (the Imam) said, ‘On leeks it is seven drops.’ I then asked, ‘How should I eat it?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Cut their roots and throw away their heads.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرفوع - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/209)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ

text: كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَأْكُلُ الْكُرَّاثَ بِالْمِلْحِ الْجَرِيشِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from one of his companions, raising it, said,
‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Eat the leak with the grained salt’.
en.sarwar: 8. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from certain persons of his people in a marfu‘ manner who has said the following: “’Amir al-Mu’minin, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, would eat leeks with not so finely powdered salt.’”
